job.name: Azure_Delete_Event_Hub

variable.description: The subscription id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: SUBSCRIPTION_ID

variable.description: The tenant id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: TENANT_ID

variable.description: ID of a Azure client application.
variable.name: APP_ID

variable.description: Secret key needed to access the Azure client application.
variable.name: PASSWORD

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the authentication endpoint of Azure REST API.
variable.name: AUTHENTICATION_ENDPOINT

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the REST endpoint for managing Azure resources.
variable.name: MANAGEMENT_ENDPOINT

variable.description: The name of the Resource Group where the Event Hub is created.
variable.name: RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME

variable.description: The name of the Namespace where the Event Hub is created.
variable.name: NAMESPACE

variable.description: Name of the Event Hub to be deleted.
variable.name: EVENT_HUB_NAME

job.description: A workflow that uses Azure REST API to delete a Event Hub.

task.name: ad_token_for_event_hub
task.description: A task performing a POST request to Azure REST API in order to authenticate to Azure and acquire an authentication token.

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

script.code:
import groovy.json.*
// =========== Manage Azure Access token ============ def slurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
access_token=jsonData.access_token variables.put("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN",access_token) println variables.get("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN")
expires_on=jsonData.expires_on variables.put("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON",expires_on) println variables.get("EVENT_HUB_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON")

task.description: A task performing a POST request to Azure REST API in order to authenticate to Azure and acquire an authentication token.

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)

script.code:
import groovy.json.*
// =========== Manage Azure Access token ============ def slurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
access_token=jsonData.access_token variables.put("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN",access_token) println variables.get("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN")
expires_on=jsonData.expires_on variables.put("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON",expires_on) println variables.get("AZURE_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON")

task.name: delete_event_hub
task.description:
A task performing a rest DELETE request using a json request body. This template supports only basic authentication, for more advanced authentication settings, please modify the template according to the rest-assured documentation: https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/wiki/Usage#authentication
It accepts the following parameters: ENDPOINT: base url of the request (inherited from job variable) USER: basic auth user (if required, inherited from job variable) PASSWORD: basic auth password (if required, inherited from job variable) PATH: path of the request (relative to the base url) SSL_DISABLE_CHECK: to disable ssl certificate check CONTENT_TYPE: content-type of the request, should be "application/json" with eventual encoding. REQUEST_BODY: a json parameter containing the request body. DEBUG: to print the full request and response content in the task output RESPONSE_FORMAT: format of the response, either - string : plain text - json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH - xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH - html: an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH - contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc) RESPONSE_PATH: which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation (https://groovy-lang.org/processing-xml.html)
Header or query parameters can also be added dynamically, by adding variables in the format: HEADER_<header_name> QUERY_PARAM_<param_name>

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: Content-Type of the request, should be "application/json" with eventual encoding.
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: Additional headers of the request, provided as a JSON key/value structure. Headers can also be specified by adding HEADER_headername variables.
variable.name: HEADERS

task.name: delete_resource_group
task.description: A task performing a DELETE request to Azure HDInsight REST API in order to remove the resource group, which name is given as input. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_authenticate_new".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
variable.name: HEADER_Authorization

task.name: check_delete_operation
task.description: A task that performs iteratively a GET request to Azure HDInsight REST API, in order to get information about the cluster deployment status. If the deployment status is "Succeeded". The cluster Web UI, SSH host and SSH port are extracted and provided as job results, then the loop stops. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_authenticate".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
variable.name: HEADER_Authorization
